summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/09/23
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Mike DePrez'], 'Producers': ['Karon Aghotte'], 'Studio': ['Three Hawks']}
Review Text: So incredible! It was so exciting and at the same time nerve wrecking! Totally worth watching.
Review Title: WOW
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/04/04
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Pellington'], 'Producers': ["Kirk D'Amico", 'Anne-Marie MacKay', 'Mark Pellington'], 'Starring': ['Shirley MacLaine', 'Amanda Seyfried', 'Anne Heche'], 'Studio': ['BLEECKER STREET FILMS']}
Review Text: First of all, this was a fun movie and am going to watch it again. Shirley, Amanda and Ann Jewel had amazing chemistry. I loved how they interacted with each other, its like they were really speaking to each other instead of reading lines. When Shirley and Amanda cuddled up like a mother and daughter would, totally teared me up. It was a beautiful moment. Personally, I thought it was ablibbed, but if it wasn't, wow oh wow! My biggest problem was hearing a child of 8 or 9 years old  constantly saying the F word ; F bomb word; B*** word, etc. I can understand she had an attitude, most neglected or abandoned kids do no matter what the families economics status is, so totally understood that, but really to hear that kind of language coming out of child and the adults accepting it as the reality and even encouraging her, well that hit a very hard chord with me. Amanda has a child, I can't imagine her letting her child speak that way. My father always said only an ignorant and lazy person uses cuss words to prove their point because they can't think of a word to use in its place.  My worse cuss word is gee whiz Louise or you jackaby (of course said firmly) and I only say it when I can't think of a quick word right then and there.
Review Title: Too much profanity for a child
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/05/07
Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Volker Schlöndorff'], 'Producers': ['Jürgen Haase', 'Jakob Hausmann', 'Wolfgang Plehn', 'Milos Remen', 'Jean-Claude Schlim', 'Jean Vanolst', 'Benigna von Keyserlingk'], 'Starring': ['August Diehl', 'Ulrich Matthes', 'Hilmar Thate'], 'Studio': ['Ammo Content']}
Review Text: The scene were he is struggling to get one drop of water is so graphic. As prisoners, the priests aren't given enough water to drink and finding the barely leaking faucet was mana to him. That really made me think about how wasteful people are with something as simple as water. You see almost empty, half empty, almost full bottles of water left behind because the person was too lazy to throw the bottle away or to finish drinking it.
Review Title: Intense from beginning to end
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/07/16
Average Rating: 3.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['The Acevedo-Smith Brothers'], 'Producers': ['Courtney Wold'], 'Starring': ['Zach Scheerer', 'Franziska Schissler', 'David Josh Lawrence'], 'Studio': ['Acevedo Smith Productions']}
Review Text: It was nice to see a movie, albeit corny acting, where  every other word was not the F word; GD word; B word, etc.
Review Title: No Profanity or sex scenes
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/08/17
Average Rating: 3.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Simon West'], 'Producers': ['Jib Polhemus', 'Harry Stourton', 'Simon West'], 'Starring': ['Antonio Banderas', 'Olga Kurylenko', 'Mark Valley'], 'Studio': ['tribecashortlist']}
Review Text: Really and truly this has got to be the silliest movie I have seen in awhile and I totally enjoyed it! Usually I am cross stitching or beading when I watch movies - but you had to stay with it because it was so fast pace and really a lot of fun to watch. With all the dramas and action movies Antonio is use to making, this was totally off the grid - I think he just wanted to do something totally out of his spectrum and just enjoy himself.
Review Title: Silly Fun Different for Antonio
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Take (2016)
Review Date: 2020/09/20
Categories: Drama, Action, Intense, Tense
Product Description: ['Idris Elba stars in this fast-paced action thriller about a rogue CIA agent who helps a small-time criminal prove his innocence in the midst of an international conspiracy.']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Watkins'], 'Producers': ['David Kanter', 'Philippe Rousselet', 'Brad Dorros'], 'Starring': ['Idris Elba', 'Richard Madden', 'Charlotte Le Bon']}
Review Text: I am giving it a 3 star simply that while I was enjoying the movie, I didn't understand what they were saying and why there wasn't any English subtitles since 99% of the movie is in French. You can pretty much tell what is going on by their actions, but that is not the point. English subtitles would have been nice.
Review Title: 99% French With No English Subtitles
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Tomorrow War
Review Date: 2021/07/04
Categories: Suspense, Drama, Compelling, Frightening
Product Description: ['Time travelers arrive from 2051 to deliver an urgent message: 30 years in the future mankind is losing a war against a deadly alien species. The only hope for survival is for soldiers and civilians to be transported to the future and join the fight. Determined to save the world for his daughter, Dan Forester teams up with a brilliant scientist and his estranged father to rewrite the planet’s fate.']
Average Rating: 4.1
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Français (Canada)', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'தமிழ்', 'हिन्दी', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'తెలుగు', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français (Canada)', 'Français (France)', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Chris McKay'], 'Producers': ['Rob Cowan', 'Leifur B. Dagfinnsson', 'Jules Daly', 'David Ellison', 'Bradley J. Fischer', 'Dana Goldberg', 'David S. Goyer', 'Don Granger', 'Hjortur Gretarsson'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pratt', 'J.K. Simmons', 'Yvonne Strahovski']}
Review Text: Come on to everyone that gave it a 1. It was a fun movie. Just enjoy a bit of fun - in this day and time when everyone is being politically and culturally correct, etc. it was nice to be able to have levity. Any movie can be picked apart, but come on, this was just a tongue in cheek movie. Of course, there was a bit of profanity which I never think is necessary to use  - please directors - find out words to replace the unnecessary cuss words. Just get some popcorn, sit back and enjoy!
Review Title: Fun Movie To Watch - Do Not Dissect
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2021/10/02
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Randy Mack'], 'Producers': ['Randy Mack', 'Stanley B. Gill', 'Brent Phillip Henry', 'Alicia Davis Johnson', 'Chantal Koerner', 'Pedro Lucero', 'Andrea Maurizio', 'Elishia McAllister', 'Andrew Grange Palmer', 'Jacques Soudelier'], 'Starring': ['Dave Davis', 'Kerry Cahill', 'Billy Slaughter'], 'Studio': ['Armak Productions']}
Review Text: Why oh why is there so much cussing in movies? Not necessary to have every other word be a cuss word! Too many movies use way too much cussing thinking that is what makes a funny movie! I stopped watching it after the first 10 minutes, knew what kind of movie it was going to be and checked out.
Review Title: Too Much Profanity
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for engaging emotional narratives, exhibiting excitement for films that evoke feelings of joy or intensity. Consistently high ratings accompany interactions with films that feature strong character dynamics and relatable themes, such as family and connection. A recurring sentiment across reviews indicates a notable aversion to excessive profanity and violence, suggesting a preference for content that maintains a level of decorum, as shown by their praise for films with less cursing.

Additionally, the reviewer values straightforward storytelling over complicated plots, favoring entertainment that allows for multitasking, such as cross-stitching while watching. Price sensitivity is not explicitly addressed in the reviews, but the inclination towards fun, enjoyable films implies a desire for value in terms of entertainment. Overall, the core preferences center around emotional engagement, character-driven narratives, and a strong disfavor for gratuitous language and violence.

target_interaction.title: Why so much profanity?
target_interaction.text: I am not a prude by any means, but I was not raised with profanity and don't use it at all, and if anyone in my family uses it, it is out of my earshot. Jiminy cricket is a serious cuss word for me if you get my drift. I enjoy sci-fi of any kind and I am enjoying this movie since it keeps me wondering what is going to happen.  I don't know how much longer I am going to watch the rest of the episodes even though I have been watching it on mute and have it on close captioned because I can't stand all the gratuitous profanity being spouted. Profanity is not necessary to have an impact on the storytelling. It seems that every movie being made right now is interjecting unnecessary profanity.
